page.title: 18RELIGION_ST.STEPHENS CHURCH
page.content: {ST.STEPHENS CHURCH}WAS BUILT OUT OF SLATE AND GRANITE IN APPROXIMATELY 1251.THE PATRON SAINT,{ST STEPHEN,}IS PORTRAYED IN THE EAST WINDOW.MOST OF THE TOWER DATES FROM THE 15TH CENTURY. SIX BELLS ARE INSTALLED AT PRESENT,THE TENOR WEIGHING OVER 813KG. THE CHURCH CAN HOLD UP TO FIVE HUNDRED PEOPLE; DURING THE THREE SERVICES HELD ON A SUNDAY,200 MAY ATTEND.THE PARISH ORIGINALLY FORMED A COMPACT AREA BOUNDED BY THE RIVER LYNHER TO THE SOUTH AND WEST,THE RIVER TAMAR TO THE EAST AND A STREAM RUNNING INTO MODITONHAM CREEK TO THE NORTH. THIS AMOUNTED TO ABOUT 2533 HECTARES IN ADDITION AN AREA OF SALTASH PASSAGE ON THE DEVON SIDE OF THE TAMAR RIVER WAS PART OF THE PARISH.IN 1881 SOME 105 HECTARES IN THE TOWN CENTRE WERE TAKEN TO FORM THE NEW PARISH OF ST. NICHOLAS AND ST.FAITH.
